title: datalad download-url into non-existent directory fails

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
I'm playing around with one of the use-cases, and I noticed that ``datalad download-url <url> --path non-existing-dir/filename`` fails:

```sh

datalad download-url -m "Added flower mosaic from wikimedia" \
  https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/Flower_poster_2.jpg \
  --path sources/flowers.jpg

[INFO   ] Downloading 'https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/Flower_poster_2.jpg' into 'sources/flowers.jpg' 
[ERROR  ] Failed to download https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/Flower_poster_2.jpg into sources/flowers.jpg: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'sources/flowers.jpg.datalad-download-temp' [base.py:_download:413] 
download_url(error): sources/flowers.jpg (file) [[Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'sources/flowers.jpg.datalad-download-temp' [base.py:_download:413] [base.py:_download:447]]
```

Where ``sources`` does not exist. If sources exist, the command works fine:

```sh

mkdir sources
╰─➤ datalad download-url -m "Added flower mosaic from wikimedia" \
  https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/Flower_poster_2.jpg \
  --path sources/flowers.jpg

[INFO   ] Downloading 'https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/Flower_poster_2.jpg' into 'sources/flowers.jpg' 
https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/Flower_poster_2.jpg:   0%| |https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/Flower_poster_2.jpg:  47%|▍|https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/Flower_poster_2.jpg:  70%|▋|                                                                                download_url(ok): sources/flowers.jpg (file)
add(ok): sources/flowers.jpg (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  download_url (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
```

I haven't looked into this further, but I will as soon as I can.
